website_summaries.verdict: Sturdy, adventurous and washable – just like him.
pros: Grip and grab straps with hook-and-loop closure
Choice of brown, grey or navy
Grip-and-grab heel tab for easy on and off
Padded collar and tongue for added comfort and stability.Anti-odor, anti-microbial mesh lining

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I used to love Stride Rite shows for my son. They are one of the few brands that have wide widths. My son loves the way the shoes fit, they offer ample room for his wide feet which is why I'm giving it 2 stars instead of 1. These shoes are very poorly made after less than two months of wear there are holes in the front. This is the second pair that this has happened to so it's not a fluke. This company needs to work on putting quality back into their products. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Hodge Podge

customer_reviews.title: Not the Stride Rite quality we're used to...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes arrived for our 4-yr old son just 12 days ago. He wore them twice to indoor day-camp, and maybe three times since then. They look awful. We've been so happy with other Stride Rite shoes for him. The photo I've attached shows the 12-day old shoes on the left, then one of his Surprize by Stride Rite that he's had since Christmas break and wore a lot, and then a brand new pair of the Surprize ones we bought at Target again this morning... because they seem to hold up! And they are honestly washable. Just... a bit hard to find. For $40, you'd think shoes wouldn't look so bad after a few hours of wear.
customer_reviews.author: L. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Kid is moderately hard on shoes, but these didn't even last 2 months (in the winter with less outside play). The soles/foot/tread was worn down in that time, the front/top of the toe portion was worn down to fabric and kid complained the bottoms (the inside arch support) hurt so bad. Stride rite usually makes a great product, but I am disappointed. To make matters wirse, I ordered two sizes of this
customer_reviews.author: WeimMom

customer_reviews.title: My son loves them so far (6 year old)
customer_reviews.text: We have only had these for 2 weeks but my son is really enjoying them. I don't know how your kids are, but my son loves whatever are his current shoes, and is hard to force next shoe graduation. It took me quite a push to get out of his last pair (which his toes were jamming into the ends of) but after less than an hour of wearing them, he was telling me how much he loved the shoes, and how they fit and how fast he can run in them (don't quote me on that one). They have held up very well to his off the beaten path treatment, and seem to go with all of his clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff R.Top Contributor: Swimming

customer_reviews.title: These shoes fit and and are inexpensive but after a ...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit and and are inexpensive but after a few months the shoes starts to wear in the front where the toes are. I've just been coloring it in with a black sharpie marker to make it less noticable. Sort of a you get what you pay for situation. My son is 7 and he had the exact same pair of shoes in a smaller size that didn't get beat up so much. It could be that he's just at an age that's hard on shoes. But I think l I'll go with a more expensive shoe next time.
customer_reviews.author: Liz and Ian

customer_reviews.title: Holes after only three wears!
customer_reviews.text: Despite being Wide, these shoes are incredibly narrow and hard to put on and fasten. Not only that but my 4.5-year-old son wore them exactly three times before the tops of the toes started to wear through, and less than a week before a hole appeared. I'm extremely disappointed considering they are Stride Rites and I thought that meant a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: nbeardsley

customer_reviews.title: I have been buying Stride Rite shoes for my son for years and this is by far the worst pair I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! I have been buying Stride Rite shoes for my son for years and this is by far the worst pair I have ever purchased. The front wore out within 2 weeks and the stitching started to come apart. By week 3, they looked awful. I sent in pictures asking for a refund but never heard back from the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado_mtns

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart within 1-2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: We have been buying Stride Rite for five years for our kids and they have all been great. We bought this pair and the first set fell apart at the front heel within the first week. Amazon sent us a replacement set and these have lasted only 2 weeks before also falling apart. Our son is not using them any different than any other shoe. I think this model is just defective. The reviews on their own website are terrible. Do yourself a favor, buy another model of shoe for your kid. What a waste of time and money. =(
customer_reviews.author: Andy Yang

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of this type of shoe I bought for my 4-year-old son. He had the blue pair that he loved and wore to school almost every day. Some reviewers mentioned that the shoes wore out quickly. I didn't find that to be true at all. After 8 months of continued use, they didn't look that amazing....but what active boy will not wear out his shoes in that time? I love them so much that I purchased them again in a different color. Amazon sells these at a great price. I also bought a pair of cute blue and pink ones for my daughter. I love Stride Rite!
customer_reviews.author: RiL

customer_reviews.title: Holes after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: These do not last well at all. After 1 month of wearing the first pair I bought were torn in places (bought blue and orange, size 10 toddler boy). And after two months I had to replace these. My boy loved the shoes though and I told him to be more careful and bought anther pair hoping for a miracle. Miracle did not happen, unfortunately. The shoes are shredded in the front and on the sides. Looking at different make and model now.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit, Good Arch Support, Comfortable, and Durable
customer_reviews.text: Stride Rite is still making fantastic shoes after many decades. They are one of the best quality shoes for children with adequate arch support. This shoe is well constructed and has been extremely durable for a 6 year old roughie. He's pretty hard on shoes but these have held up great and go with mostly everything. The Velcro closure makes it easy to get the shoes on and off without messy shoe laces (which I won't buy for little kids). I like the style and these shoes are lasting longer than other name brands. Amazon has great prices compared to purchasing Stride Rite at a specialty store...
customer_reviews.author: Liberty

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this shoe. Last year I purchased the Ian Sneaker and they were outstanding quality. Well I can not say the same for this shoe. After one wash the threads are fuzzy and the toes are missing color. Attached is the pic after one wash on delicate.
customer_reviews.author: Amber S

customer_reviews.title: Toes scraped right away.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't hold up as well as his last pair, which only last two months. Less than one month and the toes are completely busted through and rubber is gone from playing soccer on the playground. Two pairs of these shoes in 3 months is a terrible price to pay.
customer_reviews.author: GKC

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are cheap
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these shoes for my son. He’s been wearing these, water shoe, his flip flops, and another pair of sneakers that are Nike and also new. I received these Stride Rites on April 6, he did not start wearing them until around the 20th. They already have a hole in the toe. I ordered them the next size up, because I had to send back the size he normally wears if I want them to fit through the summer. Well, it doesn’t look like we’re making it to the summer and I wasted over $30 on shoes my kid could only wear for a month. I chose Stride Rite for the quality of the brand, and I was failed.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Clay

customer_reviews.title: Great support and awesome soles
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pair of stride rites I've gotten for my son and they are worth every penny and as good as they ever have been. This brand continues to be the best. These are his favorite. As soon as he tried them on he tossed his previous pair aside and hasn't looked back. The soles grip the ground well and they provide him with excellent support and balance which was critical because he doesn't walk anywhere. He runs and jumps and skips so he needed good sturdy shoes that would keep him from slipping or stumbling. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: BTLSFN

customer_reviews.title: I ordered these in an XW thinking that they would be perfect for us
customer_reviews.text: I have a two year old that has both wide and very thick/chubby feet. I ordered these in an XW thinking that they would be perfect for us. While the width is great, the shoe is too tight height wise for his chubby feet. He wore them for five minutes and had marks on the tops of his feet. The shoes are good quality and would be great for kids with wide thin feet, but if you're kids feet are thick, these aren't the shoes for you.
customer_reviews.author: KD25

customer_reviews.title: Works for as long as needed
customer_reviews.text: This shoe was recommended, by pediatrician and online, for it's sole design for kids with flat feet. I can't speak to the arch support, because I do not wear them. They do have fraying strings and the Velcro is not the best quality, but kiddo grows out of them about the time they are worn out. These are worn outside and during sport activities, and kiddo runs a lot in them. Some reviewers are upset the outside looks shabby, but these are the best sole.
customer_reviews.author: J. K.

customer_reviews.title: Pro Stride Rite
customer_reviews.text: Stride rite are made well- always hold up for my rough and tumble little boy. He usually grows out of them before he wears them out, but I have purchased other brands and he destroys them before he has outgrown. My son (4 yr) has no problem putting these on by himself and likes that they look a lot like his dad's. I think quality and care should be taken when choosing footwear. However, I don't agree with paying $40/ pair. I can usually find Stride rite reasonably priced through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: LRyan

customer_reviews.title: Horrible. Don't waste your money unless your want disposable shoes
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately my son has extremely wide feet and there are only about 3 brands that come in extra wide. I gave these to my son on Christmas, he started wearing them once school resumes so January 8th, he wears them almost daily to school and occasionally on weekends. So in less than a month of wear, holes are almost worn through the entire shoe, on both shoes. I get that kids are hard on their shoes, but in less than a month?! These are garbage. It Is unfortunate because these are the best fitting extra wide shoe. (Saucony 's extra wide is super tight leaving Mark's on the top of his feet with the velcro barely closed)
customer_reviews.author: KrisT

customer_reviews.title: Good made 2 play shoes
customer_reviews.text: We've only bought Made 2 Play Stride Rite since my child started running. So far these seem the same quality as the others, although one of the shoe tounge straps came unsewn. Not a problem actually as it seems to make it easier to put on. It is a little difficult to put on as others mentioned, but we found this difficultly in other stride rite of this style so docking a star for this reason. The best ones for putting one are two straps of Velcro but those are harder to find in my child's size.
customer_reviews.author: hni

customer_reviews.title: I've always loved Stride Rite shoes and have bought a number of ...
customer_reviews.text: I've always loved Stride Rite shoes and have bought a number of them for my son. But these ones wore out at the toe in less than 2 months. After the first month they had scuffs at the toe, exposing the fabric behind and now the holes go right through. I'd expect this out of a cheaper shoe but certainly not these. Most other Stride Rite shoes I've purchased for my son have at least lasted 6-7 months or until he grew out of them. Perhaps it's just this style.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Mizell

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SHOE!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe! Boys will be tough on their shoes. My son used these shoes as a brake while on his scooter, so of course it’s going to wear them out and eventually put a hole in them (as some previous pictures show). Regardless, I still give it full stars because they lasted all school year and we even bought another pair for the upcoming school year. We also bought different “cheap” scooter shoes so he can brake holes into those instead for those hard playing days! :)
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: My boy has not worn his best cowboy boots even once since he tried these on! Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Thought I was getting these for PE days but my everyday cowboy boot wearin' son hung up his boots for these! Bittersweet but says a whole lot about these great shoes! He has even thanked me for them many times! His boots are the best on the market and a pretty new pair too but these shoes have won his heart so I couldn't be more pleased! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: DLuvsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: My son has only had these for a month, and already the heel piece is folded over behind the fabric of the inside of the shoe. He has special needs, so we always have the shoe open before putting his foot in. He never jams them on his feet without opening the velcro, which would cause something like this to happen. Now he will not wear them anymore. I feel like I wasted my money on these. We always buy Stride Rite shoes for him, but this time we were let down.
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: XW?
customer_reviews.text: I've been pleased with this company for years - but this particular shoe had me checking and rechecking the tags and box. I bought the XW but found the Velcro straps almost went gonna cut it - only just having enough length the catch when on my son's foot. Nice shoe overall. Likely would be fine on an average child's foot - just doesn't seem as extra wide as previous designs. (The shoes purchased were a size 13.5 for a four year old)
customer_reviews.author: E. Carnes

customer_reviews.title: Not built to withstand a 3 year old.
customer_reviews.text: My son loved to wear these but the quality is terrible. After just 6 weeks of wear they have holes in them, the fabric has come away from the rubber sole and they are unwearable. We’ve had several pairs of stride Rite and this is the first real disappointment. You can see in the photos the rest of the show is in good shape, but the toes are not reinforced enough. Sending the back today.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Shoe fell apart after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: We bought this item at the beginning of September. It is now December 7th and the sole of the shoe has pulled away from the top part of the shoe leaving a huge hole that got worse every time he walked. I am a huge fan of Stride Rite shoes and have never had a problem before this pair. It kills me that I have to buy another pair of shoes in just three months.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey E. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and long lasting (Made-2-Play style)
customer_reviews.text: These things are awesome and fit/functioned just as expected. My daughter and son are both pretty rugged on shoes. We love the stride rites because of the proper postural fit, but also because of the quality and longevity. It's all we try to buy them. Just be warned, if you have kids and are hard on shoes and like to kick rocks for fun, make sure to buy the "made-2-play" versions of their shoes. I've bought other styles and they don't hold up nearly as long.
customer_reviews.author: hans m.

customer_reviews.title: Durable with a well designed sole
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair of these shoes are for my 4-year-old son and I'm very pleased. He is rough on his shoes and these are holding up very well. Additionally, the bottom soles of the shoes are designed for good traction. He has no problems running around the yard or climbing on playground equipment. Very pleased and would highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: J. Mcandrew

customer_reviews.title: Almost like a knot where a seam was finished
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fit well, but my son started complaining that they hurt his foot after a few minutes of wearing them. He is only two, so it took a little investigation to find a sharp stitch on the tongue. Almost like a knot where a seam was finished. I was able to heat up a needle and melt the offending stitch and everything appears to be good now. Three stars due to needing to alter them so they didn't hurt his feet.
customer_reviews.author: James D

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: They fit great and my 3 year old loves them. These are one of the shoes that actually fit wide when you buy wide. He loves these so much that he won't use his new shoes even though these are quite snug. So I just ordered the next size up. I deducted a star as the toe area showed major signs of wear after a week. Hes average in his wear on shoes. These are just made cheaper I think. It's not real leather and the pleather coloring rubbed off quick. The velcro has held up well though.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Great for running toddlers
customer_reviews.text: I love the bottom of these for my toddler, there is a lot of grip between the rubber material and the ridges. My son has a fat foot so we got the wide and even with it sometimes the shoes don’t fit, but these worked great! Love the ease of the Velcro.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in August and my son didn't really start wearing them until mid-October (it's warm here, he wore sandals until then.) It's now 12/15 and they're going in the trash; they're completely ripped out in front such that his socks are hanging out. The soles are still OK; the problem is that the fabric uppers are gradually detaching where they're glued, and the seams are also coming out. I'd expect that for $15 shoes from Walmart, not $40 shoes from Stride-Rite.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not up to Stride Rite quality standards
customer_reviews.text: Not up to usual Stride Rite standards... Just a couple of months in and one toe is already almost worn through, and the straps are frayed and coming apart. My son doesn't even wear these all day, because the students take their shoes off in the classroom at his preschool. Kinda bummed because Stride Rites aren't cheap. His previous pairs (different styles) have lasted until he grew out of them and barely looked worn.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline G.

customer_reviews.title: Material at toe wears down quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with fit, it was just quality. We actually sent back the first pair assuming it was a defect. After one wear the bump toe area was completely worn down. After trying the second pair, it lasted a few more wears, but still the area is worn down as if we’ve had the shoes for months instead of days. Just needs to be more durable for a two year old at normal play. These are our daily shoes and we have a very active toddler. They fit great and seem to be comfortable other than them losing their “newness” rather quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: These are great sneakers but wear out quickly
customer_reviews.text: These are great sneakers but wear out quickly. We had ours only a few weeks before they started developing holes on the front. It might have been a bum pair; Amazon replaced them for us (they are awesome), but I'm somewhat wary. My 4-year-old LOVES these shoes. So hopefully pair #2 lasts a bit longer. (StrideRite is the only company that seems to make wide size little boys sneakers, which is great. For little ones with wide feet, it's important. And the StrideRites are the only shoes that don't hurt him.)
customer_reviews.author: flyersbrb

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy shoes and my son likes them!
customer_reviews.text: They seem a little stiff to me but my son says they're comfortable and he's been running around happily since he got them. I've always liked Stride Rite the best because they last the longest. I picked these plainer brown for when he's wearing khaki pants for dress casual but still needs to run around and was afraid he wouldn't care for them because they don't light up or have any of his favorite characters on them but he was very happy when they arrived. Now that his second pair - the light up Stride Rite Storm Trooper shoes have arrived I have a feeling I know which pair he'll be wearing the most, though!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Koch

customer_reviews.title: Sizing - go up a half or full size higher
customer_reviews.text: Just received the shoes. Looks great except that it seems quite small. I'd recommend going a size up. Perhaps my LO just needs to break into them but I figure it should be lot easier getting his feet into the shoes in the first place. My LO still wears a size 5 in nautica so I know it's not an issues of incorrect sizing
customer_reviews.author: Joannah Oseni - Momodu

customer_reviews.title: Luv!
customer_reviews.text: I luv these shoes. I have recently bought my son his 2nd pair. As he needed a new size I ordered again. The color looks nice, and the hold up well to wear, and washings (air dry or dry by a vent/fan, not in dryer).
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Not for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: My son is a 6.5 wide so I bought a 7 wide to make sure he had plenty of room with socks and to grow through the winter. After wearing them in the house for about 20 minutes with the thinnest socks he has there were lines on the top of his feet. I also had to push pretty hard to get them on. Might be okay for a normal width but not wide.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes and they last a long time.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are made very well. The size is perfect , especially for wide feet. The only problem we had that my 5 year old grandson experienced is the top of the shoe above the toes was wearing away. But this was due to his dragging his feet over a rough mat under the swing set at school. That can’t be helped.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lou Noftle

customer_reviews.title: Tight.
customer_reviews.text: They are a bit tight on chubby toddler feet, but maybe that's what my little guy needs to correct his stride. His feet both point inward so these were recommended to help correct that issue. They aren't easy to get on, even with the tongue pulled all the way out though.
customer_reviews.author: Iakavou

customer_reviews.title: Busted seam after a month of wear
customer_reviews.text: I love Stride Rites for my children. The durability of the show is what makes them perfect. Unfortunately the issue that I have with them is the seaming along the front inner and outer portions of the shoe tend to come undone rapidly with extensive wear (everyday during the school day). My son began wearing his pair I. August, at the start of the school year, and last week he had to stop wearing them because his seam burst during play.
customer_reviews.author: Starr Brown

customer_reviews.title: Fit great and held up well
customer_reviews.text: Fit great and held up well. I even plan to loan them to cousins when my son outgrows them because they held up so well. I did try them on at my local Kohls first to be sure I had the right size. I have had problems with the top wearing down/getting scuffs and scratches with other brands of shoes (from Walmart), but no issues with these. Could be because my toddler is 2.5 and not crawling/dragging his shoes on the ground anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler shoe
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving these shoes a five star because they are really well-made, comfortable, stylish and easy to slip on and off. My little guy happens to have the chubbiest little feet on the planet so even the extrawide did not fit him properly. Had his feet not been so chubby, this would’ve been my choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie M. Brochu

customer_reviews.title: Outgrowing shoes before he can wear them out!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shoe!! We are on our 2nd pair now, and we are moving up the size scale as our little guy grows. He is outgrowing the shoes before he can wear them out which is amazing to say. We went through so many generic brands every 2-3 months. His 1st pair lasted 5 months before he outgrew them, and he's had his 2nd pair for 2 months now with plenty of wear left to go. I highly recommend Stride Rite shoes!!
customer_reviews.author: Randy M

customer_reviews.title: A big letdown
customer_reviews.text: We have been buying stride rite shoes for years and sadly this design didn't last us six months. The heels had holes worn thru to the bottom of the support. The toes were shredding apart and then the insides completely fell out after he walked in a river. These shoes while they were attractive and fit well we're a huge disappointment and waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Good solid sneaker
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my very active 6 year old son. They've held up well despite his best efforts to destroy them using every tool at his disposal - cement, mud, rivers, sand pits, climbing trees. Easy for him to get on and off himself. Would definitely buy again when his current ones wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Durant

customer_reviews.title: Only a week of use and they are peeling already
customer_reviews.text: I am updating the review. Honestly it’s worst that i thought. Only a week of use and the front part it’s peeling. Do they changed the material or something, because they use to last at least 3 month. They are not cheap shoes, so they should last longer. I don’t think i will buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Zaily

customer_reviews.title: The best way to buy good shoes!!  :-)
customer_reviews.text: These Stride Rite Shoes are perfect for my grandson. I believe he has grown to like a good shoe to wear so I enjoy the fact I do not need to go to a shopping center to purchase shoes and many other things. I ordered these shoes on Friday evening and they were delivered on Monday at noon. That is fast to me. I will continue to order shoes from Amazon because it is like I have a huge room of every kind of shoe I could want to buy. That keeps us at home and it comes right to our door. It just does not get any better than that!
customer_reviews.author: merm

customer_reviews.title: Not durable enough for my 5 year old
customer_reviews.text: These shoes aren't as well made as other brands. The scuff part at the top fell apart in a matter of weeks. I assumed it was a defective shoe and was able to make an exchange. But it happened again. Kids run and climb and drag their feet on their bikes and these shoes just can't hold up to it. Both shoes has holes in the toes after 2 months of daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Hilarony

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: My son has had these for barely two weeks and the material on toe is already scraped off. Very poor quality. They fit great, but they look like they are several months old when he hasn’t even had them two weeks. Extremely disappointed and wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: but we've had continued good luck with Stride Rite
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit my son so well that I bought a second pair for the school year! He can be hard on his shoes, but we've had continued good luck with Stride Rite. The velcro keeps it easy for both of us, and I can trust he won't be running around summer camp with dragging laces!
customer_reviews.author: Dazzling Dani

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy pair of shoes but not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It's true, the paint does peel off on the front. Nevertheless, these are a pair of sturdy and durable pair of shoes. EDIT: While I still think these are sturdy (talking about the shoes in general), now, after a couple of months of normal use, the part where it peels off looks just a mess, as if it has been abused for years. Wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Great, durable shoes
customer_reviews.text: My very rough toddler has been wearing these daily for almost 2 months and they still look new. He has a wide foot so I ordered them in wide and I went up half a size. I'm not sure if that has to do with why they are holding up so well. I have not noticed any of the fabric separating issues that others have had (maybe it happens when they are on the small or tight side). I also have not washed them, again maybe that will affect them? Regardless, my experience has been wonderful with these, I will order another pair in the next size up when he needs them!
customer_reviews.author: HAK

customer_reviews.title: size 2 wide - the good and the bad
customer_reviews.text: nice shoes but it is tight on top of foot. it doesnt have good arch support (does any kids shoe?) and if we put an arch support insert in, it is too tight on top of foot above arch. I got same size in a new balance shoe and it fits better, but the new balance surprisingly has a worthless insert and absolutely no arch support. SO stride right seems the better shoe but if you plan to put arch support in or child has large feet (width or height) then you may want to try a half size too big plus getting the wide size.
customer_reviews.author: All American Mall

customer_reviews.title: Not a true wide
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my son and they don't fit right. I got the wide because his feet are fat but i still can't get the velcro, velcroed across the top of his foot. He has worn Stride Rights before and we did not have this problem. I had already exchanged him a 6 wide to 6.5 wide. Very bummed about these not fitting.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Miller

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than other stride rite shoes
customer_reviews.text: Tried on some stride rite shoes in a store and ordered according to the size that he fit. This particular sneaker was not available in the store. Unfortunately, these are shorter & maybe a littler thinner than the same size found at store . Will need to return. Nice looking shoes. We would still be interested in getting the right size. 2 stars knocked off for the inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Very nice well made shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I only put my kids in stride rite shoes! My son loves this pair...they are nice looking, and of course comfortable. The sizing is correct. You can download a stride rite size chart and measuring guide on their site to help get out exactly right if necessary. This brand is a little more expensive, but their little feet are very important!
customer_reviews.author: J and D

customer_reviews.title: I love them! My son is always climbing and running
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time buying these shoes. I love them! My son is always climbing and running. The bottom of these had GREAT grip so they work well for all his adventures. They are wide enough for his feet and a great looking shoe. They are also durable. His old pair were beat up but still usable.
customer_reviews.author: VM

customer_reviews.title: Machine washable, look brand new after multiple washes!
customer_reviews.text: We have always bought Stride Rite shoes for the support and quality and will continue to do so. Not only are these shoes durable, but they are machine washable! This is a fantastic feature and why I bought these. My toddler is potty training and still has accidents so it enables me to just throw it in the washing machine with the rest of the dirty laundry. They come out every time looking brand new!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Parker

customer_reviews.title: Avoid if width is an issue!
customer_reviews.text: The shoes ordered were WIDE width, as my grandson has very wide feet. The shoes indicated that they were wide, but in all honesty, they fit his feet exactly like “regular width” shoes. If ordering the width is important, I’d definitely consider something else. Otherwise, they seem to be pretty nice, well made shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Heather c gillis

customer_reviews.title: Hole and tears in toes after one month
customer_reviews.text: Bought these shoes for my 4yo on Aug 6 and by Sep 15 they had a hole in the toe. I’ve bought Stride Rite shoes before for my boys and liked them because they were always more durable than other sneakers we tried. Definitely not the case this time and now I’m SOL because my return window is closed. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: DLCG212

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy sneakers.
customer_reviews.text: These are great sturdy sneakers. I got them for my toddler who has pigeon toes. They really seem to help and give I'm support that was lacking in his old shoes. I only wish they were a little lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda A

customer_reviews.title: Love the extra wide choice, ordered multiple sizes
customer_reviews.text: My toddler is a big boy and even nearing two years old still has the “pillow top” feet. We ordered the extra double wide shoe and they fit! So we’ll in fact that when he grew out of the 5’s last year we ordered the same pair in a 7. Easy to put on, he runs well in them and they hold up well. We have a second on the way so we hope to reuse them when the little one is ready too.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Good solid shoes for little boys
customer_reviews.text: Good solid shoes for little boys. Still holding up 4 months later. The fabric on the velcro strap is beginning to separate slightly, but overall pretty good durability. My bigger complaint is that they are difficult for my 3 yo to put on by himself; the material is somewhat stiff and doesn't open very wide unless you pull out the strap entirely from its loop.
customer_reviews.author: mom3

customer_reviews.title: Got a defective pair.  :(
customer_reviews.text: Not really sure what to say. Normally these shoes are great, but I managed to get a pair whose laces snapped immediately upon the first use. Trying to return them, but now the price has more than doubled so its not an "even exchange". I'm frustrated and annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: Review-Momma

customer_reviews.title: Another winner from Stride Rite
customer_reviews.text: Cute sturdy sneaker that promotes supported feet and ankles. They look nice enough for church and rugged enough for toddler adventures. Stride Rite is a great brand for growing feet. They are a little heavy but nothing that slows down my kiddo.
customer_reviews.author: Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Supportive and sturdy shoes that last
customer_reviews.text: I love Stride Rite shoes. My boys get a new pair about once a year (unless there is an extra growth spurt). Usually, my younger son can wear the hand-me-downs from his brother, so that one pair lasts for two kids! These shoes are supportive and sturdy. I think they are a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Mills

customer_reviews.title: I have to say I'm pretty disappointed in the quality of this pair
customer_reviews.text: Not even 4 months and they toes are almost totally wore off and the velcro is peeling off the strap. This is the first time I have had a complaint about these shoes. I have to say I'm pretty disappointed in the quality of this pair.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: We liked them so much we bought more!
customer_reviews.text: Our son had the smaller size, but he outgrew them. We liked the other ones so much we just got new ones in a bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey F.

customer_reviews.title: Quality shoes, long lasting if wear properly and not use as brake down the hill..
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my four year old at the end of April and so far no complaints from my son. The size seems accurate and shoes looks well made. I attached a photo of the shoes but keep in mind my son is super active, and the shoes held up really well...except the front part which he he used as his brake when he was riding his tricycle down the hill.. /sigh. Overall I would recommend this shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: My son loves these shoes - unfortunately quality has gone down
customer_reviews.text: I have bought my son 3 pairs of these shoes as he has grown - unfortunately this last pair barely lasted three months before falling apart. I would say they are better for younger kids, as they grow and become more active, these shoes can't handle the pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Sruby

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable favorites
customer_reviews.text: Great sneakers for an active little boy. Not destroyed yet despite that he breaks most shoes in months.
customer_reviews.author: River

customer_reviews.title: Unexpectedly too small.
customer_reviews.text: These fit smaller than expected. We got the wrong size. My grandson was 1 year and 5 months and he couldn’t fit into these comfortably...I’m sure just because of the size. Otherwise the shoe would have been great. We have used other shoes by Stride Rite and their shoes have always been great.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Bolanos

customer_reviews.title: Nice but a bit narrow
customer_reviews.text: They are very cute and well made. The bottom is rubber, which I like because it helps reduce slipping. I had to return them because my child's foot was too wide for the shoe. I wish they had fit because they looked really sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Astrid Ferera

customer_reviews.title: Velcro not long enough
customer_reviews.text: These are great in every way except the velcro strap just doesn't seem long enough. When I pull the end of the velcro to tighten them, it it's up only coming to the middle and not all the way across the shoe. These are the only stride rites we have ever had this problem with?
customer_reviews.author: Amanda H.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality!!
customer_reviews.text: I want to write a good review because my son says these shoes are very comfortable and because I really appreciate that they have extra wide sizes (hard to find)! However, this is what the shoes look like after 2 weeks and <10 wears doing normal activities. I'm so disappointed! We've had stride rite shoes that he's worn for 6 months that haven't looked this bad.
customer_reviews.author: sunnydayz

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe on the market for the price
customer_reviews.text: Kids shoes are so expensive. They wear out cheaply made shoes quickly. These Stride Rite are heavy duty well made shoes for the price. Catch them on sale and they are deal. Work the money.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe D.

customer_reviews.title: Great durable shoe
customer_reviews.text: Well made and durable for our 4 year old boy. Easy on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight shoes
customer_reviews.text: Our Grandson loves these lightweight shoes,great for running.The front fabric on these shoes is already starting to wear off after only 3 weeks or less? Most Stride Rites in the past have been more durable, will not purchase this type of front tip again,not sturdy enough for a Five year old.
customer_reviews.author: Christina L.

customer_reviews.title: I had to return for a bigger size
customer_reviews.text: What great quality shoes for our two year old! I bought this pair a few months ago and they still look great. Daddy took him to a construction site and brought him back with mud caked shoes. A good scrub and a ride in the washer, the shoes still look brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Damaged in 1 month.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes for my 8 yr old hoping for quality because of the brand. However, after only 1 month of mild use, the sole ripped off of the rest of the shoe creating a fairly large hole. Most of our other shoes from other brands have at least lasted us 6 months and am hoping that maybe this was just a manufacturing outlier.... (Because I had also bought another Stride Rite for my 7 yr old!) That said, I HAD been impressed with the quality of these sturdy shoes.... Too bad the sole started coming off!
customer_reviews.author: Tristan B Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Kid tested. Mom approved.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair we have gotten over the years and this shoe is very well made. My son shows no mercy on his footwear and these things endure. The first pair we got was set aside because he outgrew them. The Velcro closure did not get worn out and this is something that has happened to every other pair he's had.. except these.
customer_reviews.author: KoheeSan

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after 2 months!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for my 6 year old. He wore them for the first time to Thanksgiving. He has worn these shoes for just over 2 months, which includes his 3 week Christmas vacation, during which the shoes were worn very little. Today I noticed that the fabric has separated from one of the shoes by the toe. These were not cheap shoes, but they didn't last at all!!! What a waste of money. I missed the return window by 3 days!!! UGH!!!
customer_reviews.author: R&C

customer_reviews.title: Toe blew out quickly
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this shoe twice for my 5-year-old son but wouldn't buy it again. The toe blows out too quickly, perhaps because he sometimes uses his feet to brake when he rides his scooter. A lot of young kids ride scooters; the shoe should be tough enough to handle the friction. The rest of the shoe is fine, but they need to fix the toe.
customer_reviews.author: MTR

customer_reviews.title: Great brand, poor designed shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to put on a toddler who is always on the run. You need an engineering degree to get this on my sons feet . Poor design.
customer_reviews.author: angelica003

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe strap is a tad short
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great shoe. The velcro strap is a little short. My son has average to slightly wide feet. I got them in a wide which fits well overall but the strap barley reaches the other side.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Good quality Shoes
customer_reviews.text: My son wears AFO and I always buy Stride rite shoes to go over the AFO, the shoes have over the years been a staple in his closet, and I love these shoes, they are very well built and lasts a long time considering the fact that they are worn over an AFO. This time I could not find an extra wide so I bought the wide but a size bigger i thought the larger size would help with the width but theses were not as wide as I thought, but still works for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Javed Kapoor

customer_reviews.title: Look good, comfortable and good price.
customer_reviews.text: They are nice looking and comfortable for my 15 month old grandson. He is learning to walk and these shoes give him nice support. Love them. I bought them in brown also, in the next size. Price was reasonable. Stride Rite is not a cheap brand. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Julia M Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Shoe came ripped
customer_reviews.text: Once show had ripped straps which I had to super glue. Not sure why or how that happened. I've never seen stride rite shoes ripped brand new. Disappointed in the delivery as my 5 year old was upset when he opened his new ripped shoes. But I don't have time to go to the post office and send them back so super glue it is. I would expect perfect quality for the money paid.
customer_reviews.author: Amber D.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and look great!
customer_reviews.text: We have been buying stride year since my son is 2 years old and he will turn 7 in february. We have tried more expensive shoes such as new balance for him but he never wants to wear them. He loves the stride rite! We buy them in 3 colors.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Good over-all active shoes
customer_reviews.text: Over-all good shoe even though we've only had it for a few wks. My 5 yr old son has long narrow feet, (13 M) but the shoes seem to be a little tight in front. However, he is very sensitive & particular with what he wears, but was fine with these. They seem to be fairly flexible and not too stiff. And he seems to feel confident in them for active play.
customer_reviews.author: Tamar

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for little feet.
customer_reviews.text: My son loved the shoes from the moment he saw them. The color is vivid and very rich (bought the grey ones). They easily bend which is good for the little feet when they are walking. The sizing is accurate. There is great cushioning inside the shoe too. I would highly recommend these shoes especially if you have a runner like me.
customer_reviews.author: Savvymom

customer_reviews.title: My son wears these often and I'm a bit disappointed that the backs seem to be caving in (even ...
customer_reviews.text: My son wears these often and I'm a bit disappointed that the backs seem to be caving in (even if we hang onto the loop on the back) - I can't imagine they would be as comfortable to wear with the back folded in as it does. Note: it's not just the fabric, but the actual back structure of the shoe. We try to be careful when putting them on after the first shoe did it but now they both do it.
customer_reviews.author: MrsM

customer_reviews.title: Adorable shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so cute and made of good quality. Strong and sturdy. Fits well. Good support.
customer_reviews.author: TLC

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes for a Busy Boy
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great for a rough and tumbly two year old. My son can walk through the fields surrounding my parent's house or run down the pavement surrounding ours and these shoes hold up. They don't slide off his feet and they are machine washable. Stride Rite is perfect for my active boy!
customer_reviews.author: Katuna

customer_reviews.title: They're fine
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were for my son. they didn't seem as large in the toe box as his previous pair. the tongue seems short so they slide down all the time when he's putting them on and there's not much for him to pull them out with. I like the other stride rite style we had a bit better. so far they are holding up alright
customer_reviews.author: Erin M Brunner

customer_reviews.title: Did not last.  Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Quality is poor. Did not last two months. I have been a fan of stride rite and have exclusively bought their shoes for my son who is 5 since he was a baby. The last two pairs I have bought have been poor quaility and have lasted. I’m going to have to find a different brand. Poor quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for my 8 year old son. This is the third pair we've purchased. He loves them so much that when he outgrows them we buy the next size he needs in the same shoe. Will definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Mel Z

product_meta.title: Stride Rite Made2Play Toddler and Little Boys Artin-K Athletic Sneaker
product_meta.description:
Washable hook and loop sneaker

Stride Rite designs and engineers footwear specifically to meet the needs of growing children. Stride Rite's mission is to encourage kids and support parents by developing and marketing products that help children embrace life's possibilities and adventures with confidence. Stride Rite shoes aren't like any other shoes you'll buy. They're better. With more than 85 years of experience, they've learned a few things about their craft. Stride Rite is the one company that's been helping kids run, jump, leap, grow, and playfully express themselves since 1919.
feature_bullets: FUN KIDS' FOOTWEAR: These athletic sneakers feature cool neutral colors and elastic laces; Styles well with gym-class clothes and dress-code clothes alike
DURABLE AND COMFORTABLE CONSTRUCTION: Kids' sneakers feature leather and mesh upper, rubber outsole for ultimate traction and durability, and memory foam footbeds for enhanced comfort
CONVENIENT DESIGN: Stylish shoes have hook and loop closure for easy on/off and adjustability; Comes with antimicrobial lining to reduce odor
EASY TO CLEAN: These shoes for children are machine washable and can be cleaned with a damp, warm cloth using mild detergent
INSTANT OUTFIT MAKER: Stride Rite celebrates childhood by bringing you kid's footwear, with thoughtful designs and vibrant colors, making them a perfect pair with casual and formal kids clothing
